dialogues.text: ... Don'... 'member...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, you're going to have to examine her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no gynecologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she takes nothing from nobody)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made you one. End of discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clock on the side table beside the three clickers. There is the sound of a VACUUM -- it's later now. The place is incredibly changed. Christy is lying as before -- except now she is fully dressed. The bed has been made with clean sheets. There is a large black garbage bag that Collin shoves the sheets in, dumps in Christy's jewelry. Burton is VACUUMING the rug. Richmond is visible, still in terrible shape, finishing putting his clothes on in the open master bedroom. Everyone wears gloves. Everything that is incriminating is gone --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: -- except the letter opener, which has been put in a clear plastic bag. Collin reaches for it, starts to dump it in along with the sheets and the jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got their prints on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she holds out her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for sharing. Collin glances at Burton, shrugs, hands it over. Russell puts it in her handbag, puts the handbag on the bed table when suddenly -- Richmond, careening into the room, wide-eyed, crying out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria -- I killed her -- Russell, turning, shocked as Richmond bears down -- -- she holds out her arms for him, but he is staggering and he collides hard with her, spins against the wall, uses the bed table to try to steady himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, stunned, staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What he's staring at: the letter opener has spilled from her open purse and fallen behind the bed, out of sight. Russell, calm, going to Richmond, starting to lead him from the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all going to be fine, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But she's dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'll take care of everything just like I always do. (to Burton and Collin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen? She gestures to leave. Burton and Collin finish up -- Collin grabs the large plastic bag. Burton glances around one final time and backs toward the door, vacuuming carefully. Then -- Collin stops dead.   He stares across at the bed table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, holding his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? In reply, Collin dashes back toward the bed table, grabs Russell's purse, snaps it shut, tucks it under one arm and leaves. Burton flicks the light out, closes the door. The room is lit by moonlight now. Christy looks beautiful and still. HOLD for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's open and Russell leads a staggering Richmond outside. Two dark Towncars are parked in the driveway. Burton is behind them, turning off all lights. Collin is last, with Russell's purse, the garbage bag. As he follows them outside, he closes the front door firmly -- it makes a loud, solid sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound is barely audible.   He has been looking at his watch --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The watch face is illuminated in the darkness. The second hand is fifteen seconds away from the top. Luther takes a deep breath, waits in silence. The WATCH face:   the sound is loud, like "60 Minutes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton and Russell moving with Richmond toward one of the cars. Burton takes the man in his arms, leaving Russell free to open the back door. Collin dumps the plastic bag into the trunk, shuts it, moves quickly so that he can get a decent view of the road. The road in front of the house. Empty. Collin hurries to the Towncar where Burton is struggling to get Richmond comfortably stretched out on the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second hand on Luther's watch hits the top and he moves into action. -- He points the clicker at the door -- -- the door starts to swing open -- -- Luther, backpack in hand, strides quickly into the bedroom, turns, points the clicker again and as the door starts to swing shut -- Luther carefully tosses the clicker back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the clicker lands -- dead-solid perfect --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, in the bedroom, moving to the nightstand, carrying his backpack -- -- he slows as he circles the body of Christy Sullivan, looks sadly down at her, continues on as we MOVE TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The bed table. First, Luther opens the drawer and pockets the necklace. Tense, he kneels, probes behind the table, reaches farther and then -- the letter opener! In the plastic bag. Luther grabs it. He rises, opener in hand, and goes to the far window that has a view of the front of the house. He looks out, grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars are still there. Burton is visible helping Russell in. Collin hands over her purse, closes the door. He and Burton move to the front doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, going to the rear window. He opens the window slowly and silently. He ties one end of the rope around the leg of a heavy, wooden chest of drawers -- -- now he carefully plays the knotted rope out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin heads to one of the Towncars. In the other Burton and Russell are getting settled in the front. Richmond lies in a stupor, stretched along the rear seat. Russell -- -- a moment of relief. She breathes deep.    And as Russell starts to open her purse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it snakes down the brick mansion -- it reaches the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, putting his backpack on securely. The window -- Luther glances out and down.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND OUTSIDE SULLIVAN MANSION
dialogues.text: Forty feet below.   And it's dark. )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther -- he doesn't much like this -- but taking hold of the rope, he puts one leg out the window -- only the damn backpack makes it complicated and he's caught for a moment, clumsily trapped with one leg in, one leg out and the backpack wedged against the corner of the window -- -- and at that moment, there is a SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria Russell, as every nightmare she has ever had comes true -- the fucking letter opener isn't in her purse and as she screams again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, cursing to himself, forcing his way out the window and it isn't easy, but he makes it and then the rope slips in his hands and for one precarious moment, he is in serious trouble and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Towncar doors bursting open as Burton and Collin come barrelling out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, getting his grip on the nylon rope again, starting to go down -- but it's difficult going for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton and Collin tearing into the house, Collin in the lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther in the night, thirty feet up, and he can hear COMMOTION inside the house and he tries to go faster -- -- but it's not easy; the man is, after all, in his 60s and he's dangerously high and his visibility is rotten, so he's doing the best he can, but he isn't exactly flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell, standing by the Towncar, staring in at the house and from the look on her face, you know she thinks her life might be over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton and Collin, racing up the second floor staircase toward the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, halfway down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton and Collin, tearing along the third floor corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, ten feet off the ground now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom door, flying open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, six feet to go, three, and he lets go, drops the rest of the way, hits the ground running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton, racing toward the window, Collin goes to the night table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, at the end of the house, turning a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton, staring out the window and Luther is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin, looking around the table and the letter opener is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And without another word, they bolt out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, crashing through the field.   He is in wonderful shape -- -- for a man his age. And he gives it all he has but is it going to be enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Towncar as Collin yanks something out of the glove compartment, and then he is racing off into the night after Burton who is a few steps ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell staring after them -- in the back seat, Richmond is in a half-slumber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, bursting out of the underbrush -- -- up ahead is the most dangerous place for him -- -- one hundred yards of open field.   He runs on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Collin catches up to the other man, tosses what he took from the glove compartment. Thermal goggles. They put them on, on the fly and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world ahead of them as they see it: their FIELD OF VISION now resembles a rough computer game. THERMAL IMAGES register in red, everything else is dark green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beginning to tire now -- and he's only halfway through the open field and... Burton and Collin, behind him, can't see him yet, but they are moving faster -- -- and Burton could probably destroy anyone in a fight -- -- but Collin can fly. And he begins to leave Burton behind. Luther, and twenty yards ahead of him are some woods that spur him on, he pumps his arms, his body straining and his breath coming in gasps and... Collin, graceful and young and in fabulous shape and just ahead is the open field and as he starts into it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Collin sees: a THERMAL figure; a man running out of the open and then disappearing into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sight of the figure is enough to kick Collin into overdrive and he has never run this fast as he crosses the open area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, running through the woods -- he can hear THEM now, and he knows they're closing on him and he glances back -- -- and smashes into a fucking tree!... hard... and it rocks him, drops him to his knees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin and he could be jet propelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, forcing himself back to his feet and running again, giving it everything he has left and he's dodging through the trees now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton, behind Collin, but he draws his gun anyway -- Collin, in the woods, and his gun's drawn too -- Luther, out of the woods and now his car is visible -- Collin, in the woods but they're coming to an end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure up ahead is approaching a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, throwing the car door open, ripping off his backpack, tossing it inside, jumping in behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton.   Pulling up, gasping terribly.   He sinks to one knee. Collin, out of the woods! -- Still amazingly without the least sign of tiring -- -- and now there is a sound:   a CAR MOTOR STARTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther in his car, wheels spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin has his pistol ready but it's impossible to hit anything when you're running like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, in the car, GUNNING AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin.    Slowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car.    A swirl of dust. The dust clears. The car rounds a corner, is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin.    He stands there, rips off his thermal goggles -- and surprisingly, he smiles. Burton, getting to his feet, his breath still not steady. He takes his goggles off too as Collin approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still the smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got his license number. Now on that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell -- back in the bedroom, with Burton and Collin who are moving around constantly, checking the place out. Things are just amazingly tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (close to losing it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, guys, maybe it was the bogeyman -- don't forget to check under the bed -- (exploding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You may have buried us! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- relax, I got his license number, remember? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whirling on him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you think he's going to just sit around waiting for us? -- Asshole --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- take it easy, Miss Russell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying for calm) -- everybody shut up, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is staring at his reflection in the big mirror.      H crosses to it, goes to his knees, studies the rug. The rug -- indentations in the expensive carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton and Collin with a crowbar, working at the mirror. The MIRROR; there is a TEAR and a POP and it swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three going inside, looking around.    The chair, the looted shelves. The truth thuds home. Russell turns, looks out at the bedroom through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dead) A two-way mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silently, they move out into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I better get cracking on that license number --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no anger now) -- it's all we've got -- and he's got the letter opener -- blood, fingerprints -- Jesus, think what he can do --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a powerful man who speaks softly) -- the man is a thief -- a thief who witnessed a murder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it looks like he stole a whole bunch of money -- I'll tell you what he's going to do. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to run like hell. And on that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The saddest eyes you ever saw. It's the next morning and Luther is back at the same old stand, looking at El Greco. The other art students are there too. So are the suburban housewives. Everything is as it was -- calm and peaceful -- -- now a museum guard moves into the doorway, scanning the room. Luther -- a quick glance over, then back to his sketchbook -- and from that glance it's clear all is not calm and peaceful. The guard checks the room again. Edgy, Luther still works away. The guard leaves. Luther gets set to do the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, alone in his empty bar, sipping coffee.    It's befo the place has opened for the day. Luther comes in the back.    Red slides the videocassette over, Luther pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan beat us at the buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as he turns, goes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG WOMAN parking her car -- a high rocky area above the Potomac. Below, a jogging path is visible, full of runners. The Young Woman gets out, locks her car, starts down a narrow walk toward the joggers. She's in her mid-thirties. A good face.        And there' something familiar about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, standing by the edge of the jogging path, studying the runners. Now he registers something:       a smiles. The Woman in her mid-thirties as she comes jogging along. She runs well. Luther.   An imperceptible straightening of his clothes. The jogger.    We realize who she is: the little girl in the photo on   Luther's dining room table. All grown up. Now her face   registers something: his presence. Her eyes go down   to the path, she increases her speed. Luther.   Waving, calling out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. (as she runs on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. She slows, hesitates, stops. Kate, hands on hips, breathing deeply, moving to the edge of the path as he approaches. The river flows behind them. Runners pass by. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably too late for me to take it up. She says nothing -- he gestures toward the path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jogging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumb way to start this, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanted to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, the weather. (as she waits) Nights are starting to get cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That happens this time of year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther speaks quickly now, his voice low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking of maybe relocating. Someplace with a kinder climate. (nothing shows on her face) I just wanted to check it out with you first... (still nothing) ... you're the only family I've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on that -- Kate speaks quickly now, her voice low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, you don't have me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last words in this world he wanted to hear, but you can't tell from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you know what it's like being the only kid in show and tell who got to talk about visiting day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This move -- I'm talking permanent, you understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't see each other anyway -- we haven't seen each other since Mom died and that's a year. (a step toward him) Look, you chose your life. You had that right. You were never around for me. Fine. But I have no plans to be around for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now she stops, turns away toward the path -- -- Luther can say nothing, watches her -- -- then she spins back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder now) -- wait a minute -- you're lying about something, aren't you? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- are you active again? -- is that why you're here now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate moves in close now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I don't believe you -- (big) -- Christ, Father, what have you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on those words --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christy Sullivan's body. We're back in the master bedroom but now there is a lot of police activity -- people work around the corpse. The place is covered with black fingerprint powder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SETH FRANK moves into the room -- Bogart at 40. Chief Homicide Detective of Middleton County, Virginia but he had a decade of top work in New York City. Bright, funny, and tough enough for anything you want to throw at him. He kneels beside the body next to an older man. This is the MEDICAL EXAMINER, fat and bored. Seth studies Christy; sadly shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christy Sullivan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Wife of Walter -- most likely came home and stumbled onto a burglary --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- some burglary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA SIMON. Laura is early 30s, and the best lab technician Seth has ever known, and he knew some good ones in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish my carpets were this clean. And I can't find a single decent                        * fingerprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You serious, Laura?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bewildered) It's like Mary Poppins was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could someone have let him in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Seth, but the entire Sullivan household went to Barbados two days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- it gets worse -- (moving to the door) -- the shots came from here. If she interrupted a burglary, she should have been here -- (moving to the bed now) -- she was killed where she is -- all the blood patterns indicate that. But she was looking toward the bed -- what in hell was she looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth says nothing as he and Laura go in the vault.      S stares at the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like someone sat here -- but I couldn't find any prints. (lowering her voice -- indicating the one-way mirror) You think Sullivan holed up in the chair and watched his wife perform?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope not -- (shakes his head) -- he's such a great man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves back into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another cop is working on the wall by the bed table where a hole the size and shape of a bullet is visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he moves past) Careful digging that out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like he tried to strangle her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he tried to strangle her, then went to the door and shot her from behind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He also inspected her vagina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth.   Stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did what?   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he couldn't remember if he fucked her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (has to laugh) A strong burglar with a weak mind -- obviously another open and shut case...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he stares around, baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high rise. It's in a different part of Washington than we've seen thus far. Afternoon now. An old salesman type is trudging into the building. He's slumped, carries heavy salesman type suitcases. He wears a battered hat. As he goes inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The salesman is opening a mail slot with the name "Hawthorne" on the outside. A good bit of mail, most of it unsolicited. Hawthorne pockets it, unlocks the foyer, heads toward the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator and Hawthorne slowly getting out, heading toward a corner apartment, taking out some keys -- -- there are three locks on the door... he takes out keys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawthorne walks in, puts the suitcases down, flings his hat toward a long sofa -- -- it's Luther and this, we will come to learn, is what he keeps as his safe house. It's neatly furnished, modern and clean. Now he moves quickly -- -- first he opens a suitcase -- it contains his full backpack from the robbery -- -- then he opens a locked closet door, revealing a very large and sophisticated safe. As he begins to work the dial --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the TV ON in the living room as he slides the video cassette Red gave him into his machine. Everything has been put away. The TV as Michael Jordan is introduced to the crowd -- Luther sits, nurses a beer, watches intently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old man silently weeping. This is WALTER SULLIVAN, one of the giants of the era. self-made billionaire. Remarkably, the man has few enemies. At 80, his body may be betraying him -- he was once handsome -- but his mind is that of a young man. We've seen him before -- in the wedding picture on the wall of his mansion. With his young bride Christy. He is with her again now, at the morgue. A sheet covers her body. The toe tag is visible. Walter, shattered and desolate, stares at her once joyous face. PULL BACK to reveal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth Frank, studying Walter THROUGH a two way mirror. Seth is moved at depth of the old man's grief. Anyone would be. Walter slowly rises --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANDY LORD waiting in an anteroom as Walter enters... Sandy Lord is Walter Sullivan's lawyer.     He is 60, abrasive, powerful. Sandy moves to Walter, gestures toward the front door. Seth appears through another door, intercepts them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sullivan? -- I'm Seth Frank, senior homicide detective for Middleton County --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protectively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- my client is in no mood for conversation, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Sandy -- (looks at Seth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you're in charge of the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to ask some questions, but it can be tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want what, positive identification? Yes, that was my wife. Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (notebook in hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd been in Barbados for two days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took the entire staff down -- always do this time of year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mrs. Sullivan didn't come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was, had it all planned, but you know women, they change their minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Seth, softly) I'd been married to my Rebecca for forty-seven years and when she died, I decided I never wanted that pain again. One thing I knew about Christy: she was going to outlive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's enough for today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes Walter's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I have to ask about the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on that -- Walter.     Holds to Sandy for a moment, t lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the contents of the vault of course -- (turns to Sandy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sandy, you go on, I'm all right. (as Sandy looks at him a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. Go to the reception -- obviously I can't make it, but I'm sure everyone will understand. Sandy nods, exits.    Seth and Walter are alone. Beat.   Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's not the contents -- (as Seth embarrassed, stands there)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the chair. You have to ask about the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why?   Are they connected?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think someone sat in it -- and I think that someone may have been involved in the murder. (beat) You were my father's hero, Mr. Sullivan, I promise you this won't make my highlight reel.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd hoped I could satisfy her... but you know... she had needs and she didn't want to go behind my back... she suggested the chair... she hoped I might get to like sitting there... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I didn't... (takes a breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've tried for eighty years to live a decent life. I've given a billion dollars to charity. If this comes to trial, none of that will be remembered -- I'll just go out as the joke of the world. Seth.   He closes his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand, sir; I'll do what I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you listen to me whine? Please forgive me, Mr. Frank. Just do your job. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll do mine. Walter slowly moves to the door.    Seth watches him. Sadly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gorgeous SHOT of a very famous place.    The sun is setting. It all looks magical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room filled with well-dressed men and women. Formal attire. The  rich and the famous. But the only one we recognize is Sandy Lord, deep in conversation with several other men. Now, someone says his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy. (as Sandy turns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything I can do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President. And on those words -- The 44th President of the United States. He has all the natural charm in the world. He is remarkably bright, with a phenomenal memory. He is, also, at this moment, one of the most popular men in American history, three years into a brilliant first term, a shoo-in for re-election when that ritual comes. His name, by the way, is Alan Richmond, and we've seen him before, most recently lying drunk in the back seat of a dark Towncar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a walk with me. He and Sandy start out of the room. A well-dressed woman moves with them. She is Chief of Staff and her name is GLORIA RUSSELL. Two men in suits follow behind. Burton and Collin are their names and they are the best the Secret Service has to offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group, as they leave the room, come to a wide corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about Walter -- how is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty and alone, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He understands officially my hands are tied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, he's touched at your concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any news of the killer? (as Sandy indicates "no") Well, why isn't there? Who's in charge of the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top man -- eight years homicide work in New York. But I understand how you feel -- it's hard to be patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terribly upset) No one understands how I feel -- I'm supposed to have all this power but I can't help my oldest friend -- you know and I know that more than any man alive Walter Sullivan put me here -- and now when he most needs me, he must feel abandoned.

dialogues.speaker: RICHMOND
dialogues.text: On fire --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'll hold a press conference -- and I'll have Walter come -- and I will embrace him before the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy.   Listening.    Moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll treasure that, Mr. President. What a generous gesture. Thank you. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he reaches out, shakes Richmond's hand, squeezes Richmond's arm and -- Richmond -- suddenly screaming in pain -- Sandy pulls back, shocked. Richmond looks embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quick smile) Damn tennis elbow is killing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richmond, immediately after, and he sure isn't smiling now -- he storms toward the Oval Office, Russell, Burton and Collin hurrying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton opens the door for them, closes it once they're inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throws off his jacket, turns on Russell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing's worse, Gloria. I need to see a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The country would have to be informed, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to my right to privacy? (rolls up his sleeve, studies his cut)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she nicked a tendon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton says it's a flesh wound --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Burton)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- when did you become such an expert, Bill? -- Ever been wounded? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Many times. The fireplace.   Richmond goes to it, rubs his arm, stare at the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious about that press conference, Alan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I am -- Walter's been like a father to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I bring Mrs. Richmond home for it?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Richmond, turning from the fire now, quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Mrs. Richmond's mission to help the poor in Asia should not be interrupted. (takes a breath, starts to button his shirt) We know anything yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We checked his license plate -- he stole the car from a police impoundment lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not dealing with a fool here. (gestures toward his jacket, as Russell helps him into it) Has he initiated contact?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton doesn't think he will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree. (checking himself in a mirror) Sorry about my behavior -- won't happen again; think of it as a blip on the screen. And as far as I'm concerned, so is he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could be a little more than that, Alan -- he saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richmond.    Big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He saw nothing -- a drunk woman who liked rough sex too much. And he's a burglar. Who's going to believe him? (beat) After all, it's not as if he had evidence or anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on those words -- )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Luther holds it. It's the middle of the night. Luther turns the weapon over and over in his big hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton is alone in his car, exiting the gate and driving home. He turns onto the main road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up speed.   Glances around -- no cars are following. Burton reaches into his pocket, takes out a MICRO- CASSETTE RECORDER, flicks it ON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to my right to privacy? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she nicked a tendon. Burton clicks the cassette off, puts it back into his pocket. Drives into the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stove with one burner on high.   A tea kettle is over the flame. It is morning and Kate is clearly not fully awake. She is finishing making instant coffee with lowfat milk and Sweet 'n Low; next she goes to the front door of her apartment, opens it, picks up the morning Washington Post. She unfolds the paper as she starts back to the kitchen --

dialogues.speaker: WASHINGTON POST
dialogues.text: Huge headlines -- as big as you can get without a war. WALTER SULLIVAN'S WIFE MURDERED

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kate looks at it only a moment, shakes her head, then starts to turn her attention to another section of the paper -- -- she doesn't get that far. Kate:   she has seen something she didn't catch before -- The front page again.    And the headline is still there -- but there is a smaller headline beneath it: Jewel Thief Sought

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits down hard. Trying for control.      Entering a nightmare. She stares at the paper. The front page. Pictures of the mansion, of Walter smiling on his wedding day, of Christy. But Kate's eyes keep coming back to the smaller headline: Jewel Thief Sought

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to sip coffee, spills. She closes her eyes -- in the kitchen, the pot of WATER starts to SHRIEK. Kate does not move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EARLY AFTERNOON)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids riding bicycles.    Very Norman Rockwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bald man. There is the sound of a CLICK.       We reali after a moment that the bald man is Luther. Another SHOT of Luther looking very different -- full beard. Again, a CLICK. Luther again -- elegant beard this time.      CLICK. PULL BACK to reveal -- We are in the basement game room of one of the suburban homes. But our attention is on a whole string of Polaroids of Luther.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Two people are present: Luther and VALERIE.      Valerie very small, and doesn't miss much. She has been photographing him, and as the last photo slides out of the camera, she blows on it, puts it alongside the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they study the pictures) You always did disappear good, Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean I've got a weak face. Thanks, Val.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky is all -- some of my customers, they stand out no matter what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An order form book.    Valerie licks a pencil with her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many passports you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks) Four should cover it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writes this down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you'll want different looks, and matching international driver's licenses -- I'll throw in some dummy credit cards, seeing it's you. How the rugs I made you holding up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're good. Beards and mustaches, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try to give value for money. Leaving the country permanent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may come to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matter where you've been? -- I hate doing those goddam Asian passport stamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Europe's fine. Maybe the Caribbean for winters. When can I pick up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usually takes some time, but for you, I'll rush it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Val. I've always been able to count on you. Valerie puts the order book down, studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to know what you're into, but leaving forever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never figured you for a runner -- thirty percent of my runners kill themselves within five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kisses her forehead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years doesn't sound so bad to me just now. And as he heads out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth and Laura in the good-sized criminal lab.    Loaded with up-to-date equipment. Seth has drawn a picture of the crime scene. Words like "Bedroom Door," "Exit Window," "Vault," "Bed," "Victim" are written neatly to scale. He holds a sheaf of papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's late afternoon and things are already getting crazed. NOISE in the b.g. throughout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if any of this makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth mimes opening the "bedroom door," stepping inside, closing it. He makes a click with his tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Christy Sullivan and I walk in and surprise a burglar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth moves to the "vault door," mimes closing that, makes a grunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're the burglar coming out of the vault and being surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gold star. (aims his finger like a pistol) I draw my gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in) -- then why do you bother to strangle her when you could just shoot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nothing -- why do I bother to have her strip and then put her clothes back on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There I can help you -- see, before you were a burglar you were a dry cleaner and you still love beautiful clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I dress her because?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was a good customer and you didn't want her embarrassed when the police came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: Frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had a point-21 blood alcohol level. -- she was too drunk to drive. I've checked every cab and limo company in the area and not one of them knows anything. Someone drove her home. Goddamit, who? And why haven't they come forward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe whoever drove her home killed her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saying the burglar drove her home? (pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this case. An open door behind them. A TELEPHONE REPAIRMAN appears. Nice looking kid with a dazzling smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant? -- sorry to bother you
(as Seth turns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got your phone working again, shouldn't give you any more trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good service, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazzling smile as he goes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of the job. Seth and Laura.     Seth's lost his train of thought.   T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah    -- remember that bullet hole in    the wall? Had the lab dig out the    slug -- guess what -- no slug --    why does the burglar take the time    to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different from the one in her body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting more and more upset) Oh I like that a lot -- two different guns means two different burglars. Two guys broke in? And they both went out the window? Bullshit. (big) And oh, by the way, why does he -- or they -- go out the window in the first place when he -- or they -- got in by breaking a zillion- dollar security system? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Seth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whirling) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in doorway) A Bill Burton of the Secret Service in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gives papers to Laura) Here, you solve the goddam thing. (as he starts away) Did I mention that I hate this case? I really truly hate this case -- you cannot imagine how much I hate it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton waits by his car as Seth walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they shake) Bill Burton, hi --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- hi, Seth Frank --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I know you must be going crazy -- but the boss is very interested in your progress. Maybe we can help each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how close he and Sullivan are? (as Seth nods) The minute anything breaks, if you'd call me, I'd tell the President. That way, he'd be the first to alert Mr. Sullivan -- it would mean a lot to him. And any red tape you want cut -- done. (as he takes out card) Here are my numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, opens his front car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting in) Leads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still trying to figure out what might have happened --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I loved playing Sherlock Holmes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) You Secret Service guys do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was State Trooper here ten years ago before the Government got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth.     It just pops out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're that Bill Burton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton.    Embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was younger and dumber then. (quickly) Keep in touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth waves as Burton drives away. )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton. He drives alertly along, turns a corner. Up ahead, a telephone repair truck has stopped. The Repairman leans out. He has a dazzling smile. He and Burton wave to each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quietly elegant. Two men are finishing dinner.      Walte Sullivan we know. MICHAEL McCARTY, his dinner companion, is 35, fit, handsome, beautifully dressed. He is, at present, torn by a silver tray of small French pastries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noting McCarty's temptation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chef makes them especially for me -- I promise you they're sinful. McCarty grabs one, downs it, grins sheepishly. McCARTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a salesman, Mr. Sullivan. Sullivan nods as they rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tastefully appointed, as one would expect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a new arena for me, but from what I'm told, you have a flawless reputation, Mister McCarty -- which is why I need to employ you. McCARTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea who I'm after. Until I do, you will have to wait in Washington for instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCARTY Out of the question, I'm afraid. (explaining as they walk) Mine isn't particularly creative work -- I only do it because I enjoy living beyond my means. I can't afford to just sit around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sofa.   Walter gestures for them to sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was 10 my father died -- he was a miner and lung disease killed him. I became rich at 25 and the first thing I did was purchase that mine, close it, and give every miner there fifty thousand dollars to retire on. (beat; staring at McCarty now) You will come to Washington, Mr. McCarty. You will put one million dollars expenses into the Swiss bank account of your choosing. (beat) And, when the time comes, two million dollars a bullet. McCARTY (smiles, nods) You are a salesman, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selling sin is easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, sharply...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal... ... Seth and Laura, in his office.      The mug shot is o his desk, along with some folders.      Seth beckons to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying photo) Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther Whitney -- (beat) -- one of the great thieves of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth.    The words pour out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been going nuts with this thing, up all night and I remembered your notion how it might be two burglars, and around dawn I thought, wait, what if it wasn't two burglars but what if it was one guy trying to throw us off by making it look like two? (faster)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Called a buddy at the Bureau -- they keep track of this stuff internationally -- he says maybe only a half a dozen guys alive could have pulled off the Sullivan job -- I'm tracing all six -- (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but Whitney's the only one lives in Washington. Laura.   Looking at Seth now.   Starting to get excited, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why haven't I ever heard of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he hasn't been arrested in thirty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating mug shot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This his graduation picture from Harvard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving her off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ancient history -- he wasn't a jewel thief back then. Just a kid, just part of a gang, a three- time loser. But since he got out the last time, he's only worked alone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) -- and no one's touched him. (shakes his head) He gets questioned whenever anything big comes up. But nothing sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really excited now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth -- we can make this stick -- I'll bet you anything this is our guy -- a local? -- can't ask for more --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (makes a face)                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whitney hasn't killed anyone in 45 years. Laura doesn't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big deal, so he's a veteran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just a veteran -- a wounded veteran. (indicating folder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got his combat record here. Battles, commendations, decorations up the kazoo. Lives alone on his disability. Says he does anyway. (glum)                                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't do war heroes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther -- it's a beautiful morning now and he's walking up the steps to the art museum. He seems in a terrific mood as he goes inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: -- HOLD.
dialogues.text: Seth has been on the steps of the museum, watching him. Now quickly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, inside, peering back out at Seth. And he doesn't seem in as terrific a mood now. He hesitates, keeps on going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth.   Outside -- and he knows Luther was watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Greco. The usual group has gathered, sketching away. Luther is deeply engrossed in his labors. Seth enters the room, casually taking it all in. He approaches the group, ends up behind Luther who is intent on getting the hands right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, you must be smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really taken aback)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usually takes a week for you guys to get to me. (turns, smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look just like your picture, Seth. I'm Luther Whitney. He reaches out to shake a surprised Seth's hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in, go to  the food line. There is, throughout, a bantering tone.   Not that it matters, but these two, i a different world,  would like each other -- they're both in their own ways,  deeply moral men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, do you want my confession now or after coffee? As Luther draws some coffee from an urn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doing the same)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I send you away for life, I should probably check out your alibi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watched the Bullets game    with Red Bransford. Prison buddy     of mine -- runs a bar -- want to    question me about the game? I'm     probably lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They each give the cashier some money and we see a quiet table in the corner as they head for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been following the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods vigorously) I love true crime --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- F.B.I. feels only a few guys could have handled something as hard as the Sullivan job. (touches his notebook) I've got a list here; you're on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nothing shows) I wish it was true. (shakes his head) Your robber actually went in the front door but came out down a rope in the dark in the middle of the night? (as Seth nods; Luther sighs) If only I could do stuff like that -- I'd be the star of my A.A.R.P. meetings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther and Seth as they sit.     Seth smiles, looks at Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Luther? Why was this so hard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther.   Now he's surprised.    He kind of smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to help solve your case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just looking   for insight. How would you --   scratch that -- how would one go   about it? What kind of person do   you think I should be looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like a shot) Older fella. Like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now he smiles) Because?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need patience. The secret is just research, research, research -- from everything I've read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth. This hasn't gone at all the way he thought -- and he's starting to get fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Research for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, from what I can tell on the tube, it's not a small house. (as Seth nods) There had to be an architect, right? You'd be able to tell which one from public records in the library. And once you know the office, you could break in and find the plans and Xerox them, get them back before morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just steal them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth -- breaking in isn't hard -- what's hard is breaking in so no one knows you've been there. Now, after the architect, next you'd want the contractor's office -- and the security company's office. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the skill involved breaking the security of a security company? (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder how those guys do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why go to all that trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papers said he kept the money in a vault, yes? (as Seth nods) Well, I'm guessing there was probably some secret way to open it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) -- clicker --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fascinated) -- explain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- gizmo -- looked like a V.C.R. remote --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) -- amazing -- (beat) -- must have been a lot of money inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sipping casually; a pause) Five million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on those words -- Luther, more than he thought, a lot more -- but of course nothing shows -- instead he breaks out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way you said it -- as if you were trying to surprise me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I was trying to surprise you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles back) There you go.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Seth sips his coffee, takes out his notebook, opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would the burglar use a disguise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, you've got to get with the program you expect to catch this guy -- most likely it is a guy, am I right? Some kind of weird loner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (couldn't agree more) I'm the perfect prototype. (sipping away) But you see any face often enough, you'll start putting things together. That's why these top guys disguise themselves. I read a great article a couple of years back -- damn, I wish I could remember where -- anyway, it was about these makeup experts some of them use -- wigmakers, people like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flipping a page) Go on about the wigmakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love that but I'm late as it is -- got to get my pacemaker checked. (he likes Seth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- all this excitement, you understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (and he likes Luther)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A) You don't have a pacemaker, and B) I'll be back tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow is promised to no one. HOLD ON Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther is throwing clothes into a suitcase while talking on the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not 'til morning? (makes a face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'll be by early -- He hangs up, shuts the suitcase, takes off out the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A place we've seen briefly before.   Dark.   Moonlight through the windows. The sound of a KEY IN the DOOR. Luther enters, takes out a tiny flashlight. We're in one largish room, books all over. The home of someone who doesn't care a whole lot about their home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther enters. He opens the fridge. Disaster -- still water, sparkling water, carrot sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly, muttering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie darling, you've gotta try real food sometime. He closes the door, moves back into the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A graduation photo of Kate. Luther touches it with a fingertip, moves on through the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther by the bed now, he flashes his light around -- -- what the light illuminates: a bed table full of law books. Expected. A phone/answering machine. The mandatory lamp. And photographs. A proud mother and daughter picture. The daughter is Kate. The mother is a fine-looking woman with a kind face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Half a dozen more shots as Kate grew up, the mother grew older. Mother and daughter, mother and daughter. Nothing unusual here at all. So why is Luther so sad? HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 A.M. A white-brick, weather-beaten building, Old Glory fighting the breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am having this press conference here because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richmond, speaking on a podium. The press corps stands in front of him, TV crews of all kinds, CNN the most noticeable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it is here, at this courthouse,                  * that Christine Sullivan's killer will be tried for his crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton and Collin, in the b.g., scanning the crowd. Gloria Russell stands behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same shot -- only now it's grainy -- we're watching it on a TV SCREEN. CNN ON the TUBE. A BARTENDER cleaning glasses; otherwise, not a whole lot going on. Now Luther enters, dressed for travel. He goes to a stool, orders a ginger ale, puts his passport and ticket on the bar, glances toward the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn that off, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing up the glasses) In a sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richmond at his press conference.   He speaks without notes and he speaks beautifully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know, I came from an impoverished family in an impoverished town -- but we lived with our doors unlocked. Russell watching, listening; she loves hearing him talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all lock our doors now, but that is not what concerns me... Burton and Collin, scanning the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... we are also locking our hearts... that is the sadness, that is the loss. Richmond, and suddenly he's like a Southern minister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are locking our hearts to the cries of the weary, we are locking our hearts to the poor and their pain... An old man, standing behind Russell.     We realize it's Walter Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sisters and brothers, we are locking our hearts to ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Sullivan. Grainy now. CNN. He has aged shockingly in the past couple of days. Luther staring sympathetically at the devastated old man. -- Sullivan's image suddenly is gone -- -- The Bartender has TURNED OFF the TELEVISION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to argue) You said --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting through) Do it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CNN.   Walter Sullivan is still there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We feel savagery and violence must be allowed a place at table. (beat) That is wrong. That is not America. I shall fight that battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, staring at the image of Walter Sullivan, who is heartsick and beaten. Luther is simply transfixed -- -- Richmond on CNN and now he has turned and is beckoning for Walter Sullivan to join him. Sullivan for a moment is uncertain. He points to himself -- "do you mean me?" Richmond nods, opens his arms out wide. Sullivan gets up, comes forward. Luther, as he gets up too, also comes forward, leaving the stool, walking close to the television. Richmond and Sullivan, grainy on CNN as Richmond embraces Sullivan, holds him in a loving embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear friend, old friend, we shall fight that battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan, too overcome by the moment, can only nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who can explain the ways of chance? If we had never met, I would not be President. If Christine had not taken ill, she would be with you in Barbados                        * even now. Oh, Walter, you've                         * always been like a father to me.                     * I would give the world to lessen your pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The press corps.   Subdued, saddened. Richmond and Walter. They turn, face the cameras. The president's arm is still around the old man; they both blink back tears and now -- -- here it comes ! --

dialogues.speaker: LUTHER
dialogues.text: Tears of rage in his eyes.   A rage so deep it shocks him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You -- heartless -- prick -- (building)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you -- fucking -- bastard -- The Bartender, surprised, turning toward Luther. He starts to say something, stops; something tells him to shut up and he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richmond, wiping away tears, alone on camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, wiping away tears, in the bar. A SHOT of the two of them, Luther and Richmond, one on CNN, one in reality, because Luther has moved so close to the TV he and Richmond could almost be staring at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not running -- not from you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to bring you down... HOLD ON the two men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy very excited people we've never seen before. They stare around at their surroundings -- they are in the White House. On a guided tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A bright late morning of what's going to be a beautiful day. A guide leads the people through a doorway. They troop happily along. Luther is with them; he seems happy too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guide leads the people through. They look around, chat with their friends, follow the guide out. Luther follows the guide out too. HOLD ON the room. All is as it was. Except a large envelope has been dropped on a side table. MOVE IN ON the envelope -- -- it's addressed to Gloria Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria Russell.    Terrified. Her doors are closed, Russell is at her desk. Burton stands alongside. Collin, silent, sits in a corner. And on her desk, half out of the envelope, is a photo- graph of the letter opener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was in the building -- he took a guided tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton pulls the picture all the way out, studies it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never dealt with blackmail --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying for calm) -- he doesn't want money --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you a mind reader too?                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under control) No, I just looked on the back -- (shows her ) -- see? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther has written something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) 'I don't want money.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell is more upset.    Burton almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (admiringly) This guy sure has the guts of a burglar. Wish we had him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You finished your recruiting speech? Because I'd like to know how I handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you handled the letter opener?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell.     She studies Burton.   Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, Bill, that could be construed as criticism. Do you really want me as an enemy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton stands there, massively powerful. His voice, when he speaks, is his usual voice: polite, considerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Russell, I should have called the police that night. But I was weak. You convinced me to stay silent. I regret that. (another pause) Know this: every time I see your face I want to rip your throat out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell.     Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine -- you win the pissing contest -- (then suddenly almost like a little girl) -- what should I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing -- because he's making a terrible mistake, he thinks he has time -- he doesn't -- Seth Frank's too good. He'll bring him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his first words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I kill him. Now, from them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is, we will find, a top prosecutor for the Common- wealth of Virginia. Her office is a zoo. On her desk, a baby picture of Kate and her mom smiling -- but there is something a little different about it. Seth enters and they shake.    He glances around -- -- sees the photograph, glances away. Kate has risen now -- and in the silence it's clear that even though they are both standing still, they are both circling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying for a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a tough prosecutor, you don't resemble your reputation, Miss Whitney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the same)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that good or bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (before Seth can reply) Look, Lieutenant -- I told you on the phone, I'm simply not involved with my father, so this may not be a waste of time for you, but it sure is for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do if I just turned around and left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report you as an incompetent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a real smile now) You're exactly like your reputation, Miss Whitney --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they head out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter.     It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the instant they're alone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm assuming your father's a big part of you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You think it's all coincidence? He's a thief and you just happen to be the toughest prosecutor in the area?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow -- that never crossed my mind -- you think there might be some connection? -- Like maybe I'm somehow compensating? -- I better write that down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Luther disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: No reaction. A banged-up couch.     Kate sits, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you can help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant -- I don't know the man -- he was in jail when I was a kid, when he got out my mother and I went off to live by ourselves. We don't make contact. He doesn't care about me. I've seen him all of once this past year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple days ago. He said he might be going away. There. I just helped you. Can I go back to work now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Any idea where he might have gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth and Kate realize something: In a different world, under different circumstances, they'd probably be starting an affair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snappishly) Quit wasting my time -- if he doesn't want you to find him, you're not going to find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saying he's left town, skipped the country, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying you won't recognize him. I'm saying he could be just around the corner -- he always kept a safe house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never said --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Then where'd you hear this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- my mother loved him, all right? -- Even after she left him -- even when she was dying she always talked about him -- 'If only he hadn't this,' 'if only he could have that' --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops. Seth, watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meet a lot of asshole cops like you -- guys who O.D.'d on Columbo --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Lady, I may be an asshole cop but you don't know me well enough to call me one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- There's something else, isn't there? Something you want me to do? -- But you won't say --- Seth.   There is.   But he won't say. Kate.   For the first time now, apprehension.     Now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The row of small, neat houses -- where Luther lived. Kate and Seth get out of his car, go to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long did he live here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth stoops, gets the key from under the terra cotta planter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange place for a thief to leave a key, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quick memory) He always did that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter.    It's surprisingly tidy. Seth and Kate as they move along.    Seth is watching Kat who suddenly stops dead. The mantle. A large blowup of the same picture Kate had in her office, the one of Kate and her mom -- -- with one startling change: Luther is in this shot, standing there proud and smiling. She has ripped his presence out of her photo. Seth, silently watching Kate. She turns sharply away. He gestures for her to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter.    Clothes tossed all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sure took off in a hurry. What scares a professional thief like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. No reply. She has seen something across the tiny room and is drawn to it -- Luther's bed table -- -- and here it is!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Call it a montage, call it a collage, call it what you will, we are looking at dozens of photographs -- -- all of them featuring Kate. Many of them we saw in her apartment -- only here, as in the photo over the mantle, Luther is there with Kate and her mom. We are looking at a shrine! And there are newer photos too -- Kate at her college graduation, Kate at her law school graduation, Kate and her mother coming out of an elegant restaurant, Kate alone on the steps of Middleton County Courthouse -- -- these are not posed shots. She looks wonderful and alive in all of them -- Kate. She looks dead now.     All energy gone.   She sits heavily down on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fighting tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but he wasn't at those places... (pointing to the grown-up photos)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... college graduation; law school graduation; the night Mom and I celebrated when I got a job; and me alone on the steps? -- I'd just won my first case, I was so proud... (still fighting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I used to think... sometimes I'd come home and I'd sense he'd been in my apartment, checking the fridge, shaking his head because he never thought I ate right... It's crazy but I just knew Daddy was watching over me... And now she loses it, starts crying silently. Seth kneels alongside her, gives her a handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do a good thing, Kate -- (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- help me bring him in. Just leave a message on his phone machine, you're worried about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth -- you are worried about him -- this isn't your normal case -- his life may be in danger -- you can save him, make the call --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He won't come...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the pictures) Of course he'll come. You're all he has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
