dialogues.text: Kate, staring at the photos, trying to get control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving in) Kate, he's on the run   and he's scared and he's right   to be scared because he's going to   get caught -- you don't know the   heat on this.                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a murderer.                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right. Maybe he is                      * innocent. If so I'll have him                        * home and dry in a few hours. But                     * what happens if some hotshot who's trying to make a reputation tracks him down? (beat) I can guarantee his safety. You make the call, I make a promise: You'll have your father, home and dry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate alone. Totally wiped out. She is on the phone with Seth. Outside, the sun is dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left a message on his machine, he called back within an hour; we're meeting tomorrow afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, taking it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An open-air place near my office, the Cafe Alonzo -- Seth's excited.

dialogues.speaker: LATE AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: taking it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four o'clock -- it's deserted then. Burton's excited too.     HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: high in the sky -- middle of the night now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wired. Pacing across her small apartment, back and forth, back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: alone in his office, going over plans, sipping coffee to stay awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: alone in his bed, staring at the ceiling, a nearly empty Scotch bottle in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: listening to the PHONE MACHINE. We hear KATE'S VOICE. "Daddy... I miss you... I'm worried... call me..." A CLICK. Luther hangs up, immediately dials again. We hear the message start over. "Daddy... I miss you..." As he continues to listen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- on what's going to be a gorgeous day. Burton, yawning, blowing into a steaming paper cup of coffee. Collin, wide awake, moves alongside. Collin is carrying a rifle. -- we are at a government firing range. Collin squints into the morning sun. Burton, putting down the coffee cup, picking up a pair of binoculars. Burton and Collin staring out -- -- A distant target is being raised. Collin.   He strokes the barrel of his high-powered rifle

dialogues.speaker: TARGET
dialogues.text: A long way off.

dialogues.speaker: BURTON
dialogues.text: as he has focused the binoculars --

dialogues.speaker: TARGET
dialogues.text: seen through the binoculars as it comes clear -- the bull's eye is small.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIN
dialogues.text: with his rifle. His fingers still move along the barrel. No hurry whatsoever -- -- and then it all goes fast, and in one motion he is aiming and FIRING and FIRING again and the sound explodes and -- Burton, dazed.

dialogues.speaker: TARGET
dialogues.text: -- the bull's eye has been totally blown away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther and a SALESMAN are engaged in conversation. Luther is buttoning a new raincoat to the throat. The Salesman holds several hats. Luther picks one, tries it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to look really good today. He doesn't like the hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business? (as Luther tries the other hat -- very rakish, he likes it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a woman, I can tell. (as Luther nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never too late, is it? Luther.   Beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that right. Now, from his happy face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal the workmen are on a scaffolding two stories up, struggling to replace a glass panel that has cracked. The glass panel is heavy and bulky and the workmen are having a bitch of a time with it. The entire front of the building is glass panels. mirrors the area across the street -- a bunch of dilapidated brownstones. )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are empty and, according to a sign, are due for demolition. All the windows of the brownstones are closed -- except one. On an upper story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the window. Michael McCarty, who we last met at Walter Sullivan's, is there. He looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glass building and the struggling workmen and, on the ground floor, a few tables are set outside, with large umbrellas alongside each. There is a sign:    CAFE ALONZO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCarty.   Beside him is a leather case.     He opens it. The case. A very high-powered rifle. McCarty begins to expertly assemble it, taut and businesslike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, taut and businesslike, stands by a     blown-up map the Cafe Alonzo area. The restaurant is      circled -- a around it are marked places for policemen     to wait -- is giving instructions to those policemen     now -- -- fifty of them.    And no one's smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. Dressed and ready. Lying on her bed. Afternoon now. She gets up, makes it halfway to the front door -- -- can't do it -- she turns, goes back to bed, lies down again, frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cursing workmen. The glass panel is so damn cumbersome they are having a miserable time. )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elderly couple sits at one of the half dozen outdoor tables. The place is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, outside headquarters now, giving instructions to police officers. Behind them: two dozen unmarked cars.

dialogues.speaker: SUN
dialogues.text: Later in the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton, getting out of his car at Seth's Police Headquarters. Seth, finishing instructing a dozen motorcycle cops. Burton moves up behind Seth, waits quietly. As Seth is done, he sees Burton, they nod, start toward Seth's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boss is very grateful. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figured he'd    like an eyewitness report of the    capture. This is our guy -- if    he's innocent, he sure took off    awful fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three workmen.    Making some headway with the bulky glass panel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- now crosshairs cover them and we -- PULL BACK to reveal -- )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCarty, staring out the window of the brownstone, the rifle pointed -- very relaxed, he pulls the trigger -- the RIFLE'S not loaded yet -- and the STACCATO "CLICK" is all we hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth and Burton moving quickly into the lobby of the glass office building that adjoins the Cafe Alonzo -- the lobby has a clear view of the outdoor part of the cafe. Around and behind them, dozens of cops get in position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around the corner from the glass building -- unmarked cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motorcycles, waiting in shadow, out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth and Burton. They've both seen a lot -- which doesn't mean they're not tense. Burton takes out some Tums, offers them to Seth. Seth shakes his head, brings out Tums of his own.

dialogues.speaker: SUN
dialogues.text: Starting down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three workmen and they hate their job.   One of them glances down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. Now, from the workmens' angle, a woman moves to one of the tables. It's Kate. They don't pay much attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. She hesitates, then decides on the front table. She takes a breath. Sits. Motionless.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSEUP ON KATE
dialogues.text: -- now crosshairs cover her face and we -- PULL BACK to reveal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCarty as before, with his weapon. He pulls the trigger again and again, there is the "CLICK" -- now he flicks away a grain of dust from the barrel -- -- then he puts the weapon down, reaches out and -- ONE BULLET. It's supersonic ammo. McCarty picks it up, blows on it gently. He might be holding a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton and Seth.    They can see Kate sitting alone in th late afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck... -- And a goddamn WAITER has appeared and is walking out toward Kate. He is Asian and very young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, startled as the Waiter calls out from behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss? (as she spins around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you want please? His English could be a lot better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing) You sit you eat please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth and Burton.       Stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not part of my brilliant master plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More Tums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfuckingbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both crunch away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCarty, watching the Waiter and Kate. He's not happy either. He points a finger at the Waiter, goes "Boom."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, and it's almost four o'clock and she's not at her best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing around) I'm waiting for someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must eat too, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh he will, we both will -- we'll order half the menu -- but just not now -- The Waiter nods, finally he turns, starts off. Kate.   Trembling.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Waiter returning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheesecake gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiter nods again, and this time he does go. Kate, watching him, making sure.       Now she sits straight --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Very shaky, trying to hold it together. And now crosshairs cover her face as we PULL BACK to reveal --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Collin. He holds a very high-powered weapon. It looks like it could kill from a thousand yards away. Where he is -- and it's not a thousand yards away -- he's in an unmarked van on the street, even closer than McCarty. Collin, loading his weapon.       His movements are skill His concentration is total.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCarty, glancing out at the office building area. The three workmen on the scaffolding are fighting to right the glass panel. One of them grabs a rope connected to a block and tackle. He pulls on the rope.      Slowly, the piece begins to ri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, sitting alone, studying her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth and Burton.    The waiting is agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate.     It's worse for her.   She glances around -- -- nothing, no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCarty.    All the time in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin.    Blows on his weapon slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, and it's a question of how much longer she can take it. Her trembling is almost out of control -- she glances around again and -- -- and there he is! Luther Whitney himself, and he looks splendid in his new raincoat and hat -- -- he moves along in the shadow of the office building, toward the cafe, walking with his usual grace -- Luther always seems to glide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCarty in the window.    Spotting Luther -- -- totally controlled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin does the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth and Burton, and the instant Luther is visible, Seth gestures toward the policemen: Get ready. 250   INT. BROWNSTONE - McCARTY - DAY raising his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin, raising his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three workmen, raising the glass panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate.   Watching her father come closer. Luther. It's hard to suppress a smile as he walks towards his daughter. Kate, still watching. Luther, almost there.     Speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not kill that woman, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCarty, flipping off the safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin, doing the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther and Kate, and he starts to sit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, right hand raised -- he's about to start it all in motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCarty, his finger floating to the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin, doing the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, seated now and as at last, he reaches out for his daughter's hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The three workmen, and for a moment the glass panel slips and tilts and as it catches the afternoon sun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- McCarty, blinded as the red reflection hits his eyes but he FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther and Kate as suddenly the umbrella at their table is severed and starts to topple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin, startled, and he FIRES too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, instantly diving toward Kate as the second BULLET EXPLODES in the pavement close by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, stunned, because this is crazy and Burton, stunned, eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, taking Kate down to the sidewalk, protecting her body with his body and -- Madness! -- because all goes nuts now as there are shouts and screams and people running this way, that way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Seth is in the center of it all, shouting instructions, racing with Burton out of the building -- )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- unmarked cars fill the street -- -- a hundred uniformed policemen charge -- -- MOTORCYCLES ROAR in from everywhere --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Kate lies dazed -- staring at the chaos -- here come thirty uniformed policemen -- -- and here come thirty more --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- McCarty races out of the back of the building, leaps into a SPORTSCAR, GUNS away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Collin disassembles his rifle, scrambles from the van --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Burton stays close to Seth, watching it all --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The three workmen look down at it all -- then they look at each other in total confusion -- what the fuck is going on? -- -- because what they see is that the recently-deserted plaza is now stuffed with cops and more cops and vehicles and here come more and here come even more --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kate sits now, staring around, looking for Luther -- -- and Seth in the middle of it all stares around, looking for Luther -- -- because where the hell is he? A black police lieutenant, shouting for his men to spread out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Burton, turning, turning, trying to make sense of it all. Three police sergeants on MOTORCYCLES, GUNNING through the crowd. Kate, standing now, looking down -- and then she sees it -- on the ground where Luther was: a new raincoat and a new hat and -- Seth, and it's all gone wrong and it's all going crazy and there is noise and there are shouts and there are whistles. The black police lieutenant, breaking into a run, chasing after someone we can't quite make out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall uniformed police lieutenant, entering Cafe Alonzo -- -- he passes a couple of guys in chef's hats and the Chinese waiter who just gapes out toward what was his service area -- -- the tall uniformed police lieutenant moves gracefully past -- -- it's Luther. He goes to the front door of the place, glances back toward where the NOISE is still mounting -- shakes his head -- out the door and gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to Kate's apartment opening and Seth coming in with Kate. Evening. Kate is as drained as you'd expect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Messy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that in a woman. She doesn't smile. Seth, giving her back her keys and a piece of paper.    H voice is raw from all the shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top number's local police -- (as she nods) -- other two are my office and home. (off another nod) I live alone, too, call anytime. Want me to get someone to spend the night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got surveillance outside. And I'm keeping it on 'til this is over. I've got a feeling he's going to try and contact you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on a hot streak, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate.   Nothing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything unusual, call me right away -- not a bother, I live alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he knows that) Feeble, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.    They look at each other.    Then he starts t the door.    Slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything for the road?     I've got water and water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter and she opens the fridge --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: -- and it's full of food: milk and fruit and cookies. Kate stares, then quickly glances at Seth. He just points to a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pelligrino would be great. (off Kate, who can't help it, breaks out laughing) What's funny, I say it wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she hands him a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they move toward it.      He opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I've told you this, but I live alone. (and this time, as she does smile, and he does go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock it behind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LOCKING it loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real good.    Try and sleep. His FOOTSTEPS get softer, DISAPPEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still facing door, her back to her apartment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I betrayed you, Luther. You better know that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not the first. As Kate turns, Luther, standing there, is looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to know I'm not a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this afternoon. To the restaurant. Why'd you come then? You must have suspected something, or you wouldn't have been prepared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply) My daughter wanted to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the couch -- as Kate sits.      Luther, and before she's even seated, he's into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robbery went fine 'til they came in. They were drunk. I hid in the vault. Sex got rough. He was going to kill Christy, but she turned the tables, was going to kill him. Two guys came in, shot her dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same two guys who tried for you this afternoon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably only one of them. I think Walter Sullivan might have hired the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty powerful enemy; good going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as powerful as the President of the United States. Kate just looks at him. Dead silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richmond was drunk. The two guys are Secret Service. Chief of Staff Russell planned the coverup. Kate just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dead silence. Luther.     Studying her.    Not a great reaction. Kate.     Little shake of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every word true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying you're innocent of the murder? Why in the world should I believe you?

dialogues.speaker: LUTHER
dialogues.text: Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I swear on Mattie's grave.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Rocked -- Luther, going to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your mother's grave, Kate -- you know I'd kill myself before I'd lie about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. Looking at him.        Because he wouldn't lie, not about that. Everything he's told her, all true. The air goes out of her. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft) Jesus, Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther as he sits beside her on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was set to. At the airport. All the money I'd ever need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I saw that bastard using Sullivan on the T.V. -- maybe I couldn't have saved that woman, Kate. But I didn't even try. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you think of me and I know what we've been to each other -- (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- haven't been to each other. And it's not the time to try and explain my life --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: watching his face now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but I've never robbed anyone couldn't afford it and I've never stiffed a waitress. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Alan Richmond has to pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much, maybe -- but I only went to jail when I had partners. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People betray each other, Kate -- nowadays, when there's a group, someone wants to write a book --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- these people hate each other. And if I can drive them just a little bit nuts, who knows how they'll react under pressure? (rises and looks at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad for the talk, wish we'd had more. Luther crosses to the door, turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is probably it; you understand that. (as she does, he still looks at her. Then -- )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was never going to tell you this, but I watched you argue a case last year -- thank God you got your brains from your mother. Kate standing now, too -- they're across the room from each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dangerous outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It always is -- (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and I may not make you proud, Kate -- (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but I'm not going down alone... And on that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elegant high-rise in Washington. Crisp, cool afternoon. A DOORMAN stands outside, enjoying the day. A well-dressed man rounds the corner; he holds a small, beautifully-wrapped package with a small envelope attached. He moves to the Doorman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it's Luther) For Miss Gloria Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it) Want me to sign anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head) I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he turns, walks quickly away as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The envelope being opened. It's early evening now. message inside is short and clear -- "Gloria, Thanks for the rescue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell smiles, and as she opens the package --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful necklace. Antique mostly likely. And tasteful -- we hear the sound of an ORCHESTRA PLAYING WALTZES. PULL BACK to reveal Gloria Russell, looking just splendid, the necklace around her throat, entering a large and very impressive White House dinner-dance. Clearly an important affair of state. We've never seen Russell quite      like this -- relaxed, secure in her femininity. She       nods distantly to Bur and Collin who are, as always,      close the President. the first time now, we realize      something: Gloria Rus is hot for Alan Richmond. Richmond, on the edge of the dance floor, chatting with some elderly couples, several of them European, all of them wealthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Russell approaches) You're a vision this evening, Miss Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. President. (beat) And thank you, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't understand) For? (off her, radiant, indicating the necklace) Come again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time she touches it -- he bends close to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) You sent it to me this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause -- then...

dialogues.speaker: RICHMOND
dialogues.text: So happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course. (now, to the others) Excuse me, all -- I am overcome with the desire to dance with my Chief of Staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand to her -- Russell, beaming, moves out onto the dance floor with him. Everyone at the gathering, watching them. Richmond and Russell, very much aware that all eyes are on them -- -- what we don't know is this: they are both wonderful dancers. And they seem to be reveling in their moves -- -- because throughout this, they never stop smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this nonsense? I'm hoping there's an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Your gift, Alan -- I was overwhelmed -- and your note was so gratifying --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in) -- I sent a note?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, you think I don't know your writing? I assumed you wanted me to wear it tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The necklace.       He looks at it as they spin gracefull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is lovely, Gloria -- and you know what else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do a perfect dip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Alan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christy Sullivan wore it the night she was killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell, a quick glint of panic, a gentle peal of feminine laughter. Richmond and Russell -- he bends her back, their mouths are close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize what this means? Whitney's been heard from.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSELL
dialogues.text: They spin and glide.       Long pause.   Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not precisely the first time, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC is BUILDING TO CLIMAX now.       Their movement become more grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (so happy) You've been keeping things from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only because you have so much on your plate, Alan; we wanted to spare you. (beat) He sent me a Polaroid of the letter opener yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: RICHMOND
dialogues.text: A kick in the teeth -- -- he summons all his control, goes into even more complicated movements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd of elegant men and women, it's really wonderful dancing they're seeing -- they start to applaud. Richmond and Russell, hearing the sound. Richmond acknowledges it with a smile as they come to climax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now -- (a final flourish) -- I need time to think -- come see me in my office in the morning -- (beat) This will certainly make for an interesting chapter in my memoirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as they bow... The crowd applauding louder, while on the dance floor, the President of the United States and the Chief of Staff applaud happily back. As the sound builds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther in the night.    Silence. He is moving across the rooftop of a home. He carries a briefcase -- Luther's making business calls. Ahead is an attic window -- as he slides it open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, slipping inside. Some stairs are just across. He goes down them, opens the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther stepping into the main part of the dark house. He stops. No noise at all except that of someone BREATHING DEEPLY, coming from an open bedroom door. Luther passes by -- for an instant we can see that Burton is asleep, an empty bottle by his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther rounding a corner -- -- and we can tell immediately he's in a different house now. Burton's had only old furnishings, these are modern and new. Luther pauses, listening.     Nothing. He moves forward then, turns another corner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and now we can tell he's someplace else -- this is an apartment with a large window looking out on the city. Luther doesn't stop to admire the view.    He moves silently on... HOLD ON the window. And suddenly:   Dawn -- the sun is starting to rise. PULL BACK to reveal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria Russell, as the ALARM GOES OFF.    She sits -- -- she stretches -- -- then she stares -- something has been taped to her lamp. We are looking at an issue of the Washington Post -- Russell's photo smiles out -- there is a headline that says simply: RUSSELL TO BE CHIEF OF STAFF. Written across her picture are the words: "This shitstorm is your fault -- if we go down, you go down!" Russell takes the paper down, stares at it. Furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton, hung over, staggering into the kitchen of his home, stopping dead. A newspaper is set beside his coffee pot. A front page of the Washington Post. Years back. The lead article reports that a siege has been successfully broken -- -- Burton, bloody and wounded, is being carried to an ambulance. A hero. Across the top these words have been written:

dialogues.speaker: HOW DID THIS HAPPEN, YOU GUTLESS FUCK
dialogues.text: Burton stares.   Steaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin, yawning, going into his bathroom -- -- across his mirror is taped a large white piece of paper, across which is written in thick black marker -- "If you could shoot for shit, we'd be out of this." Collin angrily rips it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of commuters and businessmen are buying papers. The newspapers. Washington, New York, Philadelphia -- and they're all different front pages, of course, but one photo in all of them is the same -- -- every one of them is running the mug shot of Luther. And the sense of the stories is the same too: HAVE YOU SEEN THIS MAN?

dialogues.speaker: COMMUTERS
dialogues.text: crowded around, making their purchases. Some of them are young, some of them are half asleep. One of them is in his 60's and very wide awake -- -- it's Luther -- -- as he buys a paper, looks at the headline -- fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still early morning -- Collin is going through Burton's desk hurriedly -- -- when Burton surprises him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closes the desk, shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needed a pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to his desktop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's pens -- (moving in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you don't trust me? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I don't answer to you, asshole
Russell in the doorway now, glaring at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're both assholes, now move -- And on that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The note that was sent to Russell and the Polaroid of the letter opener. PULL BACK to reveal -- The Polaroid and the note are on Richmond's desk. He studies them. Russell, Burton and Collin stand silently watching him, their hatred of each other clear. The smell of death's in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding the note now, his voice is, when he speaks, calm; to Burton)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea who could have forged it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96                    10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to Seth Frank -- apparently Whitney learned how in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very gifted man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window as he walks to it, looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And are we close to stopping him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're working round the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll make a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to know that too.

dialogues.speaker: RICHMOND
dialogues.text: With more meaning than the words convey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one other thing you'll want to take care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other three, looking at Richmond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure you want to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) She's a young prosecutor, prosecutors ask questions -- she might know what he knows... (a reassuring smile) Let's get cracking, shall we? (beat) Show you love your country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On those words --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate Whitney, getting into the elevator.    Off to work. She pushes for the lobby. The doors close and the elevator starts down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate checks her purse to see if she has everything.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR BUTTON
dialogues.text: The "L" is lit -- -- but when the elevator gets there, it does not stop but goes straight on down to the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's strange.     She instinctively moves to the rear o the car. ODD SOUNDS from the basement.     Kate's just the least b tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ODD SOUNDS are LOUDER. And the doors don't open when they should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and now she's starting to get a little scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors sliding open and the Super standing there with tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Miss Whitney, but this thing's giving us a little trouble. Kate nods, smiles back, relieved. )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, leaving her building, going toward her car, getting in. Down the block is a police car. Two surveillance cops inside. Kate starts to drive -- and so do they. Kate turns a corner -- -- and so do they -- -- and as they do, they pass Luther, parked on the corner. Watching. Satisfied, he drives off in another direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, heading out of the city.    The sun is higher in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several cars. Traffic is moving slowly.     Luther continues to drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, coming out of her office building, hurrying along the sidewalk. Lunch hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes past some brownstones -- the two cops walk behind -- -- the window of one of the brownstones is open, shadowy movement from inside -- -- Kate hurries past, not paying attention... Cops don't either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a figure begins to appear in the window -- The figure holds something long and thin, like a rifle barrel -- -- it's a large woman with a long mop -- as she shakes it -- Afternoon and the sun is strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight, streaming in an open bedroom window.          W bedroom, though? Two maids are cleaning it -- -- and now we realize where we are: Walter Sullivan's bedroom, but it's all been changed, different rug, different fabrics, different furnishings. The maids work silently and well. A final sweep of a dust rag here, a last tug at the bedspread there. Done.   They go to the door, take a last look around. Perfect. They go. HOLD ON the empty room. Keep HOLDING. Now, silently, the vault door opens -- a gardener steps out, clicker in hand. The gardener -- it's Luther -- he clicks it, tosses it back inside -- -- the door starts to close -- -- but before it shuts, we can see he's returned what he took the night of the robbery. And as he moves silently toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The outskirts of Washington.       Mid-afternoon now. Luther's at a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, as he picks up the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther.   Fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not staying on long enough for you to track this, just answer me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She couldn't be in better hands -- talk about catching a break, Secret Service called me. They're taking over surveillance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The telephone swinging back and forth -- -- and in the b.g., a car MOTOR ROARING away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, coming down the elevator again -- in her jogging clothes now. She has pushed the lobby button. The elevator stops suddenly on the second floor -- -- The Super gets in, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it working fine, Miss Whitney. Kate nods, smiles back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, driving like crazy through the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, getting into her car in front of her building, driving off -- no one is behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, HONKING his HORN as he barrels around a corner, scattering traffic. )B(    ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate drives into the park past a sign reading:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, gunning along -- up ahead the park is visible now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, following an arrow that leads to the parking lot. Luther, in the park, now, suddenly shouting "Shit" as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "DETOUR" sign. Kate, entering the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, out of his car now, running like crazy through the park. Ahead is a sign saying: "JOGGING PATH."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not many other cars so she gets a space in front, overlooking the river, and as she stops, takes out her keys --

dialogues.speaker: BURTON AND COLLIN
dialogues.text: Collin at the wheel, ROARING in behind her, rear-ending her hard. -- there is a SCREECH of BRAKES and a SCREAM --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther as he hears the terrible sound, keeps running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate in her car as it teeters at the edge and then starts its long fall to the jogging path far below. )B(    ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton and Collin in their car, driving like hell away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, running INTO VIEW, stopping dead, helpless now, staring at the worst thing in the world --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's car, careening against a rocky ledge, then cart wheeling the rest of the way down, landing horribly, spinning, finally coming to rest upside down and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther running to the car; hands shaking, he manages to pull front door open and reach inside -- -- now there are cries as other joggers stop and stare and -- Kate, as Luther pulls her body out of the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Kate...? -- no response -- it's impossible to tell if she's alive -- -- in the distance now, the sound of an AMBULANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AMBULANCE, SIREN SCREAMING. PULL BACK to reveal -- Early evening now, getting dark, and the ambulance braking in front of the emergency room of a large city hospital -- -- as doctors and attendants with gurneys come pouring out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A private room. Later.      Kate is bandaged and attached a bunch of equipment -- -- but however faintly her breathing, it's still breathing and it's steady. She's alone for the moment in the semi-darkened room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty.    A doctor comes walking along -- it's Collin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate in her room, sleeping.     Another doctor is with he now, checking her charts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin. He sees what's going on, stops, pulls out a small notebook, pretends to read it, all the while glancing toward Kate's room with the one doctor still there -- -- now from around the corner, NOISE, COMING CLOSER -- SEVERAL PEOPLE APPROACHING, perhaps more. Collin turns away from the sound, curses, then stops -- -- The doctor is done with Kate's charts. From around the corner now, the group coming closer still. Kate's doorway as the doctor exits and Collin enters -- they pass each other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Collin moves a step further into the room -- -- and now there is something in his hand -- -- a hypodermic needle. Kate.    Out of it.   Lying there, eyes closed. Collin, the needle ready, moving silently toward the bed. Kate is barely breathing.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And now suddenly Collin is barely breathing -- -- because the other doctor's arms have viced around Collin's neck, forcing the air out of him. Collin, stunned, trying to struggle -- The doctor jerking Collin's body into the air -- his feet are dangling now -- the hypodermic needle drops to the bed as the struggle goes on -- -- and Collin's in fabulous shape. He's young and power- ful and he's been in terrible situations before and he knows how to fight and he's been taught to defend himself and -- -- tough shit -- -- the doctor -- it's Luther -- relentlessly increases the pressure against Collin's throat -- -- Collin can't even gasp now -- -- his feet can't kick anymore -- -- his body starts to go limp -- -- his eyes start to slide up into his head -- -- silence in the room -- -- it's almost over -- -- which is when suddenly Luther lets go. Collin, eyes flickering open as Luther lays him down on the floor. All this next is whispered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scream. Go on. Which do you want most, for me to kill you or life in jail forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has gone across the room to the bed.     Collin tries move, can't. The hypodermic needle as Luther picks it up carefully, starts back to Collin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to guess this wasn't to pep her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring, eyes wide) ... you're not going to kill me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... why do you think that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you could have but you didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther.   Kneeling by Collin now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because you didn't know your crime, prick. -- and now he jams the needle against Collin's neck. Collin tries to cry out, but Luther covers his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kneeling close, almost whispering into Collin's ear) I didn't mind you tried to shoot me at the restaurant -- I wouldn't have minded if you'd nailed me at Sullivan's -- part of the job -- (beat) -- but you fucked with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin.   Terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... mercy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, bending over him.       Luther pushes the plunger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fresh out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collin dying now. His breathing is getting strange, his body starting to stiffen. And on that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Daddy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, eyes barely open. From her position Luther is simply kneeling, nothing else is visible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... go to sleep, honey...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She tries to stay awake, can't make it, drifts off. Kate.     She closes her eyes. Collin.    Luther closes his eyes for him.     Now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gurney with a figure on it being pushed by a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dumpster outside -- -- the gurney is there -- -- the figure isn't -- -- the sound of a CAR GUNNING into the night and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth coming out of the shower. He puts a towel around him, wipes the steam off the mirror, cries out -- -- Luther is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need one answer -- when you interviewed Walter Sullivan, did he say why Christy didn't go to Barbados?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Just that she changed her mind. (studying Luther) You know who did it, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So will you -- check your phones --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) -- who'd tap a police officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply -- Luther's already headed for the door as we -- )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Sullivan, getting into his limousine in front of a Georgetown mansion. Later in the evening. The car starts to move. Walter looks frail and very old now. And somehow smaller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter huddled in the back seat, as the street lights illuminate him. He might even be ill. In any case, a sad figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limousine, turning a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter.   Blinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a shortcut, Tommy?                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns; it's Luther)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your replacement driver for the evening, sir. Don't worry, Tommy's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very unusual -- what do I call you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And are you familiar with how to get to my home, Luther?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the way, sir -- I'm the man who robbed you -- Sullivan says nothing; stares unsmiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and you're the man who tried to have me killed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm sorry I missed -- I believe in the Old Testament, sir -- there is nothing wrong with an eye for an eye when a terrible deed has been done. (ice) A deed such as yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to believe that, don't you? -- Makes your life a lot simpler if you believe that, isn't that right? (big now) What do you think I gain being here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan.     Contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have no idea -- you going to rob me again? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need your money, Mr. Sullivan. Look in your vault lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he has) I'm afraid we're a little late for an attempt at leniency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAR.    A SCREAMING TURN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit's coming down tonight, Mr. Sullivan, do you want to be a player or not? (bigger) Do you want to know what happened, or not? I saw. Your call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you up to hearing about it? -- Do you want to hear how he beat the shit out of her and tried to strangle her -- you have enough left for that? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a nod) -- I could walk through fire --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, fast now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the chair when they came in. (as Sullivan says nothing) They were drunk -- at first he only wanted to bruise her -- she fought back, he went for the kill -- she turned the tables. Then he screamed for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else was in my house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret Service shot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't like it) Nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria Russell handled the cover up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- don't you want to know who the man was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) It was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're too old to bullshit each other, Mr. Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big) Who was it then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bigger) You know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan, shaking his head as Luther roars on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking well do, don't shake your head at me -- when you're alone at night, when the rage takes you and you think of what you'd do to revenge her, on those nights you put a face to your enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming apart) Stop the car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we're going all the way, Walter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it's too terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure is. Walter Sullivan.    A long, shaky moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I know about Alan's reputation as a philanderer... but... he would never dream of betraying me... I gave him the Presidency. Luther and Walter as Luther turns a sharp corner and the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pressing it) The press conference -- remember? -- he held you in his arms and said if only Christy hadn't gotten sick she would have been with you                     * in Barbados --                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bigger) -- how do you think he knew she was sick? You didn't tell anybody. But he heard it, all right. He heard it from her. That night. And I heard every word --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter. For a moment, no reaction. Then he sits back hard. The air's out of him. He just breathes quietly. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not real proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther.   Handing something back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan takes it -- -- it's the letter opener. Sullivan leans back, shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have stolen this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did steal it. But that isn't my blood and those aren't my prints.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Eyes still shut -- -- and he's very old and you expect tears -- -- but he didn't get to be Walter Sullivan by crying -- -- HOLD ON Walter -- -- and this incredible shriek of rage explodes! -- Luther, suddenly stopping the car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and we're at the rear of the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter.   He sits in the back a moment. Then he gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther has gotten out too. They stand close to each other. They nod. Then Walter starts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns -- quiet now, at peace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did love her, you know. And he walks away. A White House SECURITY GUARD as Walter approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he working late? I haven't an appointment but I'd like to see him if I might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need an appointment, Mr. Sullivan. And as he waves him through -- Luther, standing there, watching the old man. Walter, a final turn back, a nod of the head. Luther.   He nods back, returns to the car, gets in -- -- and now we begin a BLIZZARD OF CUTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther driving through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter entering the White House proper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, with a bunch of other officers, standing in front of an office with the name "BILL BURTON" on a plaque -- he opens the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: -- Burton has blown his brains out. A note alongside reads: "I am so sorry." Alongside the note is a micro- cassette recorder and a dozen tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther.   Driving faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Sullivan approaching a METAL DETECTOR -- he starts to go through -- -- it GOES OFF -- Walter's embarrassed.    He holds up his wrist, showing h watch. The security guards smile, wave him to go ahead. Walter continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, tense, ROARING along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria Russell -- Seth is with her -- he cuffs her, leads her out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, by the door of the Oval Office.    The letter opener is tight in his hand now. The door opens. Richmond, arms out, comes to embrace him, as he embraced him at the Press Conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther pulling up into the parking lot of the hospital, getting out, passing the parking lot attendant who is listening transfixed to a small radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(    ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... in the greatest shock to the nation since the Kennedy assassination, President Alan Richmond's death has rocked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther has moved past now; we can't hear the radio anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther enters. A number of people are present, all of them listening to a large radio, on the desk of the Information Clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Richmond died violently in the Oval Office and Walter Sullivan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther has moved past now; we can't hear the radio anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dozes.     Luther sits alongside in a chair. Outside, the moon is high in the sky. Kate blinks, half opens her eyes, sees Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you're still here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't budged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dozes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coffee machine in a lounge.       Empty.   But a TELEVI SET IS PLAYING SOFTLY. Luther enters, gets some coffee. The TV is SHOWING the PRESS CONFERENCE Richmond held. As we WATCH, Walter Sullivan moves down toward the President and they embrace.

dialogues.speaker: 347A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now the Press Conference is over and we are LIVE AT the FRONT OF the North Portico of the WHITE HOUSE. A ton of reporters -- -- and Walter Sullivan, in their midst, beckoning for quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Sullivan, have you no idea why the President took his own life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther stops making coffee, looks at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice soft) I know he's been feeling the pressure of office more than ever lately. We've talked about it a great deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why would he stab himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a question that will haunt me forever. Of course I tried to stop him -- (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Alan was like a son to me... Luther smiles, takes his coffee, leaves the room as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sleeping. Seth stands there now. Luther enters with his coffee. Seth sees him and they both move to the door and confer silently -- -- Seth indicates Kate. Luther crosses his fingers. Seth says something we can't make out. Luther nods. Seth glances a final time at Kate, then leaves them. Luther moves to Kate, studies her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )B(    ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes still closed) ... was that Seth...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just checking in. When you're up to it, he said we might come over for dinner. He mentioned --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes half open) I know, he lives alone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Watch it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He arranges her sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you don't have to fuss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were forever catching colds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, drifts and we --

dialogues.speaker: MOON
dialogues.text: starting to fall out of the sky now.

dialogues.speaker: LUTHER
dialogues.text: stands by the window, looking out.       Soon, dawn.   He stretches, crosses to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... am I going to be all right?....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long pause) We'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods, drifts. Luther watches her. Then he goes to his chair --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: -- reaches down -- -- pulls out his sketchbook. He turns the pages. Drawings of Kate. He turns to a new page.    Starts drawing her again.   He really getting good. HOLD ON Luther and Kate.
